name: LGoodDatePicker 11.2.1
body:
### About Central Repository releases
This release was published to the Maven Central Repository on 2021-03-17

### Enhancements in this release:
*This is a bug fix release only*
### Bug fixes in this release:
- Fix for issue #122 `JarInputStream` could not detect the **MANIFEST.MF** file within our *LGoodDatePicker* release JAR files. 
As a result *Gradle* would not detect the manifest and its `Automatic-Module-Name` attribute.
Since we slightly altered our packaging process to fix this issue: Please notify us if you have any issues with our new packages.

name: LGoodDatePicker 11.2.0
body:
### About Central Repository releases
This release was published to the *Maven Central Repository* on 2021-02-28

### Enhancements in this release:
- Colors of the date and time picker in disabled state can now be customized, contributed by @vorlo 
- New localization: Icelandic, contributed by @bjorndarri 
### Bug fixes in this release:
- Fix for issue #110 month and year menu of `CalendarPanel` don't close when clicked a second time while the popup is open.

name: LGoodDatePicker 11.1.0
body:
### Central Repository releases
This release was published to the *Maven Central Repository* on 2020-09-30

### Enhancements in this release:
- It is now possible to customize the colors used when the mouse hover highlight is active for labels (clear/today/year/month) on the calendar panel:
  ```Java
  dateSettings.setColor(DateArea.BackgroundCalendarPanelLabelsOnHover, /*your background color used during highlighing*/ );
  dateSettings.setColor(DateArea.TextCalendarPanelLabelsOnHover, /*your text color used during highlighing*/);
  ```
  this feature was contributed by @YlaSplinter

name: LGoodDatePicker 11.0.2
body:
### About Central Repository releases
This release was published to the *Maven Central Repository* on 2020-09-05
### Enhancements in this release:
*This is a bug fix release only*
### Bug fixes in this release:
- Fix for *custom clock* setting not being applied to `TimePicker.setTimeToNow()` method
- Fix for `NullPointerException` is thrown if `TimePicker.setText(null)` called
- Fix for issue #102 `NullPointerException` is thrown if `new CalendarPanel()` called

name: LGoodDatePicker 11.0.0
body:
#### Enhancements in this release:
- Added new feature: `DatePickerSettings.setClock()`.
This function enables a programmer to set the clock used to calculate the date value displayed in the calendar panel using `YearMonth.now(datePickerSettings.getClock())`. Contributed by @ArchieBlack 

#### Bug fixes in this release:
- Fixed issue #82 "Closing window with currently opened date picker pop up yields exception"
- Fixed two problems related to date parsing:
   1) Case sensitive date formats were always invalid. 
   2) Release `10.4.1` introduced an issue that date formats using `yyyy` (*YearOfEra*) instead of `uuuu` (*year*) or `yyyy G` (*YearOfEra* with added *Era* identifier) were not recognized as valid.
- The above items fixed the following issue reports:
   - issue #60. "Issue with validating `DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern('ddMMyyyy')`" (different fix than in `10.4.1`)
   - issue #74 "False invalid Date"
   - issue #76 "Date Format Issue"

name: LGoodDatePicker 10.4.1
body:
#### Enhancements in this release:
- Added new feature: DatePickerSettings.setDefaultYearMonth().
This function enables a programmer to set the default year and month displayed in the calendar window, to be a value besides YearMonth.now().
- Added the JSR 376 'Automatic-Module-Name' to MANIFEST.MF.
- Fixed issue #60. "Issue with validating DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern('ddMMyyyy')".
- Fixed issue #61. "Calendar panel drawing issue on MacOS"
- Add two DatePickers to the FullDemo class, to document functionality asked about in issues #60 and #65.

name: LGoodDatePicker 10.3.1
body:
#### Enhancements in this release:
- Added listener notifications for changes to the YearMonth.
API change note: The "CalendarSelectionListener" class was renamed to "CalendarListener".
(This completes Feature Request #54.)
- Added the function "getDisplayedYearMonth()" to the DatePicker.
(This completes Feature Request #53.)
- Added the colors for the selected date to the customizable colors in the DatePickerSettings. 
(This completes Feature Request #55. Thanks @ArchieBlack)
- Enhanced the pom file to allow developers to optionally build the project from source, without first installing the GPG signing tools. (Thanks @decenthappiness)

This version was also released on [Maven Central](http://search.maven.org/#search%7Cga%7C1%7CLGoodDatePicker), and as an [LGoodDatePicker Backport](https://github.com/LGoodDatePicker/LGoodDatePicker/releases/tag/Backports).

name: LGoodDatePicker 10.2.3
body:
#### Enhancements in this release:
- Added the option to change all Date Picker fonts and colors, in DatePickerSettings.
(This completes Feature Request #35, and Issue #51.)
- Increased the default acceleration speed for the time picker spinner buttons.
(This completes Feature Request #34.)
- Added the Norwegian language to the translations. 
(Thanks @Jarand95.)

This version was also released on [Maven Central](http://search.maven.org/#search%7Cga%7C1%7CLGoodDatePicker), and as an [LGoodDatePicker Backport](https://github.com/LGoodDatePicker/LGoodDatePicker/releases/tag/Backports).

name: LGoodDatePicker 10.1.2
body:
#### Enhancements in this release:
- Fixed a bug that was occurring under some versions of MacOSX (aka "macOS"), with Java 8 update 121 or higher, where the date field would not populate when a date was selected using the mouse. (Issue #49)

name: LGoodDatePicker 8.3.0
body:
#### Enhancements in this release:
- Fixed an bug that was occurring under some versions of Linux, where the DatePicker could close without populating the date text field.
- Added the Finnish language to the translations.
- Added getBaseline() functions to the picker components for improving control of form layouts.

This version was also released on [Maven Central](http://search.maven.org/#search%7Cga%7C1%7CLGoodDatePicker), and as an [LGoodDatePicker Backport](https://github.com/LGoodDatePicker/LGoodDatePicker/releases/tag/Backports).

name: LGoodDatePicker Backport Releases (All)
body:
**These are Backport Releases.** The backport releases of LGoodDatePicker are intended for projects that need to target Java 6 or Java 7. These releases depend on the [JSR310 Backport Library](http://www.threeten.org/threetenbp/), which is included in the zip files. The "JSR310 Backport Library" is a backport of the standard Java 8 "java.time" package, adapted to run in Java 6 or Java 7. 

If your project can target Java 8 or above (can compile with Java 8), then it is recommended to use a Standard release instead, which does not have this dependency. Any release of LGoodDatePicker without the word "Backport" in the title, is a standard release. 

Below are all the Backport versions of the library. Each backport release has instructions in the zip file. The newest version numbers are towards the bottom of the downloads list.

Note: If the latest Standard release number is not in this list, then feel free to [Email](http://www.emailmeform.com/builder/form/ZQcYut4393) us to request that we update the backport list.

name: LGoodDatePicker 8.2.2
body:
##### Minor enhancements in this release:
- Added the ability to hide the date picker text field. Usage example: A developer may want to do this, if they were providing their own component for displaying the selected date. (To use this feature, see the function "DatePickerSettings.setVisibleDateTextField()". )

This version was also released on [Maven Central](http://search.maven.org/#search%7Cga%7C1%7CLGoodDatePicker).

name: LGoodDatePicker 8.2.1
body:
##### Minor enhancements in this release:
- Added a convenience function for limiting the available date range on a DatePicker. (Feature Request #44.) The new function is called "DatePickerSettings.setDateRangeLimits()". Technical note: This function works by creating a veto policy that implements the desired date range limits.

name: LGoodDatePicker 8.2.0
body:
#### Major enhancements in this release:

This release fixes a critical Linux related bug, adds a new language translation, and adds to the optional visual customization capabilities.
- Fixed an intermittent critical bug under Linux, where the DatePicker could display as a blank window when opening the calendar. (Thanks to @mcwolfmm for developing this fix.)
- Added the Bulgarian language to the translations.
- Added public accessor functions for the DatePicker buttons: PreviousYear, PreviousMonth, NextYear, and NextMonth. These functions allow the developer to customize the appearance of those buttons if desired.
- Modified the POM file to allow Linux developers to build the source code. (Thanks to author @liponcio.)

This version was also released on [Maven Central](http://search.maven.org/#search%7Cga%7C1%7CLGoodDatePicker), and as an [LGoodDatePicker Backport](https://github.com/LGoodDatePicker/LGoodDatePicker/releases/tag/Backports).

name: LGoodDatePicker 7.6.3
body:
##### Technical enhancements in this release:
- Enhance the compatibility of all picker components with the visual designer environments of various IDEs, including NetBeans, Eclipse, IntelliJ, and the JFormDesigner program.
- The picker BeanInfo classes now provide a combination of introspective and custom bean information, which gives coverage of all the component properties.
- Improved the data binding features of the picker components.

This version was also released on [Maven Central](http://search.maven.org/#search%7Cga%7C1%7CLGoodDatePicker), and as an [LGoodDatePicker Backport](https://github.com/LGoodDatePicker/LGoodDatePicker/releases/tag/Backports).

name: LGoodDatePicker 7.6.1
body:
#### Major enhancements in this release:

This release adds multiple enhancements for IDE visual designer integration, for the table editors, and for JavaBeans data binding. A new demo class has also been added, to show the JavaBeans data binding capabilities.
- Added a custom manifest file which lists the visual JavaBean components. (The DatePicker, TimePicker, DateTimePicker, and CalendarPanel.) This allows the programmer to more quickly filter and add the picker components to the visual designer palette of their preferred IDE.
- Added picker component icons which will show up in the palettes of visual form designer applications.
- Added a JavaBeans data binding demo to the demo applications. This demo can be run from the full demo (see the "data binding demo" button), or it can be run independently.
- Added new data binding firing events for picker components native data types, and their text values. This increases the data binding capabilities of the components.
- Added "BeanInfo" classes for all the picker components.
- Fixed various minor Javadoc warnings.
- Added the ability to specify a click count in all of the table editor classes. This allows the programmer to specify if table cells should be editable with a single click, or with a double click
- Added the ability for table editors to match the table background color. This ability can be enabled or disabled by the programmer. (It is enabled by default.)

name: LGoodDatePicker 7.5.2
body:
#### Minor enhancements in this release: - Implemented a feature to restrain the DatePicker and TimePicker popup windows to always stay inside of the screen working area. The popup windows are now prevented from being displayed outside of the edges of the screen (or behind the taskbar), regardless of the position of the parent date or time picker.
(This completes feature request #29)

name: LGoodDatePicker 7.5.1
body:
#### Major enhancements in this release: - Added the new "Table Editor" classes to the library, which allows the picker components to be directly added to the cells and columns of a Swing JTable (or a SwingX JXTable). The new classes are named DateTableEditor, TimeTableEditor, and DateTimeTableEditor.
(Technical note: These classes can function either as a table "Editor", a table "Renderer", or both.) - Added new source examples and a demo program for the TableEditor classes. The table editor demo can be started from the full demo using the new button named "Show Table Editors Demo". - Added support to all the picker components for JavaBeans data binding.
(This completes feature request #28.) ##### Minor changes: - Added the ability to optionally disable the arrow keys handling in the TimePicker. (This was needed for the new TableEditor classes.) ##### API changes: - The DateTime getter and setter functions in the DateTimePicker class have been renamed, for compatibility with the new JavaBeans data binding features. - The similar DateTime getter and setter functions have been renamed in the DateTimeChangeEvent class.

name: LGoodDatePicker 7.4.4
body:
##### Enhancements in this release:
- Added new TimePickerSettings that allow customization of the background colors in the TimePicker text area. (This completes feature request #25 .)
- Moved the previous TimePickerSettings color variables, to use the new function: TimePickerSettings.setColor().

name: LGoodDatePicker 7.4.3
body:
##### Minor bug fix in this release:
- Allow dynamic updating of highlight or veto policies from within a calendar selection listener. (Previously, the calendar would need a second redraw event to fully update during certain specialized use cases. This completes issue #23.)

name: LGoodDatePicker 7.4.2
body:
##### Minor enhancements in this release:
- Added the ability to enable or disable the month popup menu, or the year popup menu. (See the functions: DatePickerSettings.setEnableMonthMenu()  and DatePickerSettings.setEnableYearMenu().) 
- The above enhancement completes feature request #24.
- Renamed one of the DatePickerSettings.Area enumerations, for consistency with the other area names.

name: LGoodDatePicker 7.4.1
body:
##### Minor enhancements in this release:
- Added the ability to hide any (or all) of the navigation controls in a DatePicker or an independent CalendarPanel. The navigation controls include the forward and back month/year navigation buttons, the month and year popup menu buttons, the "Today" button, and the "Clear" button.
- Added the ability to change the default background color in the date picker text field. (The new color settings were added to the DatePickerSettings.setColor() function, and to the DatePickerSettings.Area enums.)
- The above items complete feature request #22.

name: LGoodDatePicker 7.3.3
body:
##### Minor enhancements in this release:
- Implemented DatePickerSettings.copySettings(). This makes it easier to duplicate DatePickerSettings instances. This completes feature request #21.

name: LGoodDatePicker 7.3.1
body:
#### Major enhancements in this release:
- Added the ability to change the Locale after the construction of the DatePicker or the independent CalendarPanel. This completes feature request #18.
- Added the ability to replace the DatePickerSettings instance after the construction of the DatePicker or the independent CalendarPanel.

name: LGoodDatePicker 7.2.4
body:
##### Minor changes in this release:
- Changed the Javadocs and the function names for the week number settings, to make the week number behaviors more clear. (Note: The implementations for these functions have not changed.)

name: LGoodDatePicker 7.2.3
body:
##### Minor changes in this release:
- Added examples to the demo program for setting custom calendar border properties.
- Dynamically set the minimum size for the optional week number labels based on the current week number font. This keeps the calendar panel at a constant width when switching between months with single digit and double digit week of the year numbers.

name: LGoodDatePicker 7.2.2
body:
#### Major enhancements in this release: - Added the option to display week numbers (weeks of the year) in the DatePicker and the CalendarPanel. - Updated the demo application to include a DatePicker with week numbers. - Added the ability to fully customize the calendar borders, border colors, and thicknesses. - Consolidated the functions for changing the calendar color settings. - Generalized the underlying calendar form layout.
(Note: The appearance of the calendar to the user has not changed.) - The new form layout is designed to supply the following capabilities: The calendar will have better edge matching behavior whenever the calendar size is changed. The week numbers area can be shown or hidden. The calendar borders can be customized to a desired design, or individually displayed or hidden. ##### Bug Fixes: - Fixed a bug where the border settings were not being fully initialized in the DatePicker class.

name: LGoodDatePicker 7.1.2
body:
#### Enhancements in this release:
- Implemented liberal mouse clicking on all calendar panel date labels and "label buttons". Previously the mouse needed to hold still to perform a click. Now, a calendar click can be registered if the mouse moves (within the target component) between the mouse pressed and mouse released events.
- Updated three color functions in DatePickerSettings to redraw the calendar when those settings are changed after constructing an independent CalendarPanel.

name: LGoodDatePicker 7.1.1
body:
#### Major enhancements in this release:
- Adapted the DatePickerSettings to implement dynamic settings changes in the independent CalendarPanel. 
- All DatePickerSettings variables now use accessor functions for public access. (This was needed for the above features.)
- Changed the internal structure of the calendar panel layout managers for greater control of the edge spacing whenever the calendar panel is resized.

#### Bug fixes:
- Fixed a bug where the veto policy of an independent CalendarPanel could not be set after construction. (This fixes Issue #17.)

name: LGoodDatePicker 5.4.2
body:
### Minor changes in this release:
- Improved the function for showing the Java target version in the demo application.

name: LGoodDatePicker 5.4.1
body:
#### Major enhancements in this release:
- Custom image icons can now be added to the DatePicker and TimePicker buttons.
- Implemented dynamic default sizing for the TimePicker component. (The DatePicker already has this feature.) The default width is calculated from the current time format. The width can be overridden by the programmer if desired.
- Added accessors to retrieve the DatePicker and TimePicker internal swing components, to allow for greater visual customization of all the swing elements.
- Added convenience functions to the TimePickerSettings class, for setting the time formats from a pattern string.
- Added examples to the demo for the new features.

name: LGoodDatePicker 5.3.2
body:
#### Major enhancements in this release
- Adapted the library to make the source code syntax compatible with Java 6. This makes it possible to backport the library for any projects that are unable to upgrade to Java 8.
- Added the [JSR 310 Backport Library](http://www.threeten.org/threetenbp/) as an optional dependency in the POM file.
- Added some developer instructions to the POM file for releasing the project as Java 8+ (Standard), or Java 6 and 7 (Backport) versions.
- Fixed a bug in the default Turkish language date format, to remove the name of the weekday.
- Added a button to the demo to show the current (compiled and running) Java versions.
- Performed a recursive styling format on all source files.

name: LGoodDatePicker 5.3.1
body:
#### Enhancements in this release:
- Implemented dynamic minimum widths for the DatePicker text field. The minimum width for the text field is now calculated to fit the "largest date" (with a four digit year) that can be displayed using the current DatePickerSettings. The settings used in this calculation are the locale (the translation), the date format for CE dates, and the font for valid dates. If desired, the programmer may also override the default minimum width. (This enhancement completes [Feature Request #13](https://github.com/LGoodDatePicker/LGoodDatePicker/issues/13).)
- Added two convenience functions for setting the date format from a pattern string, in DatePickerSettings.

name: LGoodDatePicker 5.2.3
body:
#### Enhancements in this release:
- Implemented multicolor highlight policies. Highlight policies can now (optionally) have unique background and foreground colors for any particular highlighted day.
- Updated the demo application to show the new features.

name: LGoodDatePicker 5.2.2
body:
#### Minor changes in this release:
- For clarity, renamed the DateSelectionListener class to CalendarSelectionListener. This class is used when listening for selection events in independent instances of the CalendarPanel component.
- Updated the introduction message in the FullDemo to include information about the TimePicker component.
- Added a few more examples to the BasicDemo class.

name: LGoodDatePicker 5.2.1
body:
### Major enhancements in this release:
- Added the **CalendarPanel** component to the library. Previously, the "CalendarPanel" class was not accessible to the programmer. It was a (private) member of the DatePicker class.  Now, the CalendarPanel may be used as an independent component. **Note:** Directly using the CalendarPanel class is optional. (Instantiating a CalendarPanel is not required to use the DatePicker.)
- Updated the demo application to include the (independent) CalendarPanel component.

##### Bug Fixes
- Fixed a rare NullPointerException, that was occurring in the DatePicker on some operating systems.

name: LGoodDatePicker 4.3.2
body:
#### Minor changes in this release:
- Added three new examples for the time picker to the demo application. The new examples show how to set the time picker to use seconds, millisecond, or nanosecond precision time values.

name: LGoodDatePicker 4.3.1
body:
### Changes in this release:
- The project was modified to meet the list of requirements for publishing to the Maven Central repository.

#### Technical details:
- All release jar files are automatically signed with public-key encryption signatures during each build.
- A private copy of the JGoodies forms library is still in the project, but the inclusion method was modified.
- A separate reduced pom file is now generated from "pom-for-users.txt". This will fill the requirements of users that are building with Maven, or downloading from Maven Central.
- The main jar file name was modified to fit the standard Maven naming conventions.
- The package names for the project have been changed to meet the project coordinate requirements of Maven Central.

name: LGoodDatePicker 4.2.1
body:
### Enhancements in this release:
- Added "time spinner" functionality to the TimePicker. The spinner functionality can be controlled with the spinner buttons, or with the keyboard arrow keys.
- Implemented TimePickerSettings attributes that can turn on or off any of the button controls on the TimePicker. This allows both the toggle menu button and the spinner buttons to be optional.
- The arrow keys can increase or decrease the TimePicker time on all time pickers, with minute precision. (This ability is always on, even if the spinner buttons are not displayed.)
- Implemented the TimeSpinnerTimer class, which enables the spinner functionality to change the TimePicker time at a rate that smoothly accelerates, according to how long the user holds down a spinner button.
- Updated the demo application to show the new features.

name: LGoodDatePicker 4.2.0
body:
Release notes:
This release applies similar improvements for the TimePicker class, as the release 4.1.5 applied for the DatePicker class. These changes consist mostly of internal source code improvements.

Changes:
- Modified the code related to all the TimePickerSettings variables to allow changing any settings after the TimePicker is constructed. (Instead of only changing settings before construction.)
- Resolved potential conflicts between allowEmptyTimes, initialTime, and vetoPolicy. 

API modifications:
- Several TimePickerSettings variables were moved to accessor functions.
- The TimePickerSettings.setVetoPolicy() function can only be called after the time picker is constructed.

name: LGoodDatePicker 4.1.5
body:
Release notes:
This release consisted mostly of internal source code changes and improvements.

Changes:
- Modified the code related to all the DatePickerSettings variables to allow changing any settings after
  the DatePicker is constructed. (Instead of only changing settings before construction.)
- Resolved potential conflicts between allowEmptyDates, initialDate, and
  vetoPolicy. 
- Added the setEnabled(), and isEnabled() functions to the DateTimePicker.

API modifications:
- Several DatePickerSettings variables were moved to accessor functions.
- The DatePickerSettings.setVetoPolicy() function can only be called after the date picker is constructed.

name: LGoodDatePicker 4.1.4
body:
Minor changes:
- Implemented setEnabled() and isEnabled() for the DatePicker and TimePicker. 
  (This was feature request #8.)

name: LGoodDatePicker 4.1.3
body:
Minor changes:
- Added the getSettings() function to the DatePicker and TimePicker.

name: LGoodDatePicker 4.1.2
body:
### Major enhancements in this release:
- Designed and implemented the **TimePicker** component.
- Added the **DateTimePicker** component. This allows a DatePicker and a TimePicker to be treated as single unit.
- Updated the demo application to include these new features.

name: LGoodDatePicker 3.1.1
body:
### Changes in this release:
- Added functionality to the calendar to allow easier changes between a large range of year values. This will greatly reduce clicking for dates such as a birthday, with a year that is far in the past. The new year editing option can be accessed from the bottom of the Year menu.
- Implemented feature request #7: The ability to make a date picker non-editable from the keyboard, and editable only with the mouse.
- Created a workaround for an inconsistency in the Java libraries regarding the recognition of the Hindi language locale.
- Technical change: Implemented the JIntegerTextField class to support the upgraded year editing functionality.
- Updated the demo to show the new features.

name: LGoodDatePicker 2.4.3
body:
Changes in this release:
- Fixed a display bug with the Nimbus look and feel.

name: LGoodDatePicker 2.4.2
body:
Enhancements:
- Added 10 more translations, for a total of 22 languages.

name: LGoodDatePicker 2.4.1
body:
Major enhancements:
- Rewrote the demo application to display multiple language translations, and to show the various new DatePicker features.
- Expanded the color and border customization abilities in the date picker settings. 
- Consolidated the date picker close event listeners to be managed internally by the CustomPopup class.

name: LGoodDatePicker 2.3.0
body:
Changes in this release:
- Renamed the settings variables for quick visual searching. (In DatePickerSettings.)
- The Russian translation was adjusted, from pull request #6.

name: LGoodDatePicker 2.2.3
body:
Changes in this release:
- Implemented a generalized method for getting the grammatically "standalone version" of localized month names from Java.

name: LGoodDatePicker 2.2.1
body:
Requested enhancements in this release:
- Added the ability to allow or disallow empty dates. (null dates).

name: LGoodDatePicker 2.2.0
body:
### \- Release Notes -

#### Major enhancements:
- Removed the dependency on JGoodies forms. The date picker now has no external dependencies.
- Added the ability to resize the date picker in the DatePickerSettings class.

#### Minor enhancements:
- Added the weekday labels background color to DatePickerSettings.

name: LGoodDatePicker 2.1.3
body:
This release includes the following enhancements:
- Added the month translation strings to the DatePickerSettings class, so that those strings can be customized at will by the programmer.
- Added overrides for the Russian month names. This corrects a problem with the grammar of the Russian localization.

name: LGoodDatePicker 2.1.2
body:
Minor changes in this release:
- Added a DateChangeEvent class. This class is used by the DateChangeListener.

name: LGoodDatePicker 2.1.1
body:
Minor changes in this release:
- Bug fix in the DateChangeListener related code.

name: LGoodDatePicker 2.1
body:
Added requested new features:
- Added support for converting the native java.time.LocalDate value to or from a java.util.Date.
- Added a DateChangeListener class and its associated event generation code, so that listeners can register to be notified when the date on a DatePicker has changed.

name: LGoodDatePicker 2.0
body:
LGoodDatePicker 2.0, released 19 February 2016.
This release includes all the features of LGoodDatePicker to date.

Major features include:
Uses the standard Java 8 time package. This package is also called "java.time" or "JSR-310"
Automatic localization. Translated to 12 languages so far.
New highlight policy, and veto policy features.
Simple usage, creating a DatePicker is one line of code.
Compact and clean code base.
Open source MIT license.
